intro: Tetrastigma yunnanense f. hirtum, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed bittersweet, is a climbing vine native to China. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
